author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...CATEGORY 5 MELISSA MOVING SLOWLY WEST-NORTHWESTWARD AND EXPECTED TO TURN NORTHWARD LATER TODAY... ...CATASTROPHIC AND LIFE-THREATENING WINDS, FLOODING, AND STORM SURGE EXPECTED ON JAMAICA TONIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY...
summary: ...CATEGORY 5 MELISSA MOVING SLOWLY WEST-NORTHWESTWARD AND EXPECTED TO TURN NORTHWARD LATER TODAY... ...CATASTROPHIC AND LIFE-THREATENING WINDS, FLOODING, AND STORM SURGE EXPECTED ON JAMAICA TONIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY... As of 2:00 PM EDT Mon Oct 27 the center of Melissa was located near 16.5, -78.3 with movement WNW at 3 mph. The minimum central pressure was 906 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 175 mph.

As of 2:00 PM EDT Mon Oct 27 the center of Melissa was located near 16.5, -78.3 with movement WNW at 3 mph. The minimum central pressure was 906 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 175 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Melissa (AT3/AL132025)
